use_cases.description: Researching industries and identifying potential acquisition targets; reviewing teasers and CIMs (confidential info memos).
Collecting and analyzing publicly available data, financials, and expert calls on a target company.
Managing detailed due diligence with consultants (market, financial, legal); synthesizing findings into internal reports.
Building leveraged buyout models and projecting returns for investment opportunities.
Drafting comprehensive memos or decks that summarize the target’s business, investment thesis, risks, and deal terms for decision-makers.
Analyzing industry trends, competitors, and market size to inform investment decisions.
Preparing questions for management meetings and later summarizing management call notes for the deal team.
Reviewing and summarizing key deal terms, debt financing offers, and structuring options (involves analysis of financial impact).
Helping craft the post-acquisition value-creation plan; tracking performance vs. plan and reporting on progress.
Analyzing quarterly results of portfolio companies and writing update reports for internal use or Limited Partners.
Researching market conditions, comparable transactions, and analyzing scenarios for exiting investments (IPO, sale, etc.).
Reviewing pitch decks and business plans from startups; summarizing key points and filtering out non-fit opportunities.
Investigating emerging industry trends or new technologies to identify promising sectors or companies.
Meeting with startup founders and taking detailed notes; summarizing those conversations for the partnership.
Evaluating product-market fit, traction metrics, financial projections, and customer references for potential investments.
Comparing a startup’s offering to competitors; benchmarking metrics and extracting insights from industry reports.
Writing internal memos that summarize the startup’s business, team, market, and risks for the investment committee (partners).
Analyzing and summarizing deal terms offered to startups; comparing to market standards.
Tracking portfolio companies’ KPIs (growth, burn rate, etc.), analyzing their performance, and advising on strategy or follow-on funding needs.
Summarizing portfolio company updates for the partnership or Limited Partners (e.g. quarterly portfolio reviews).
Scanning incubators, hackathons, and tech news for new startups or technologies; maintaining a knowledge base of relevant developments.

sector: Buy-Side Firms (Hedge Funds, Asset Managers, Family Offices)

use_cases.description: Researching markets and companies to find new investment ideas; reading news, filings, expert transcripts to discover opportunities.
Performing deep analysis on stocks, bonds, or other assets (e.g. reading 10-Ks, modeling earnings scenarios, evaluating management commentary) and summarizing findings.
Continuously tracking current positions’ performance and risks [cite_start]; analyzing price moves or earnings results and explaining drivers.
Building and updating valuation models (DCF, comparables, etc.) for potential and existing investments.
Drafting internal memos that articulate the rationale for a trade or investment, including summarized research, catalysts, and risk analysis.
Summarizing portfolio risk reports (exposures, VAR, stress tests) for portfolio managers or risk committees, often with scenario analysis commentary.
Preparing summaries of fund performance, attribution analysis, and market outlook for investors (e.g. monthly or quarterly letters).
Tracking macroeconomic indicators and market trends; summarizing economic research or central bank commentary to inform strategy.
Reading or listening to expert network call transcripts relevant to an investment and extracting key insights (increasingly with AI assistance to summarize transcripts).
Analyzing new regulations or compliance requirements (e.g. short disclosure rules, ESG mandates) and summarizing their impact on the portfolio or strategies.
Building detailed financial models (DCF, LBO, merger models) and performing valuation analyses for deals or coverage companies.
Conducting deep research on companies and sectors to support deals or reports (e.g. reading industry reports, regulatory filings, news).
Preparing deal pitchbooks, client presentations, and marketing materials that synthesize financial data and industry insights for a potential transaction.
Writing research reports on companies: initiating coverage reports and earnings update notes that distill financial results and provide investment recommendations.
Listening to or reading earnings call transcripts for covered companies and summarizing key takeaways for inclusion in research notes or client updates.
Communicating with clients and sales teams about research views or deal updates, including crafting clear email summaries and talking points.
Gathering data on comparable companies or transactions and analyzing key metrics to support valuations (for equity research or M&A deals).
Reviewing data room documents, legal filings, or third-party reports during M&A due diligence; extracting relevant findings for the team.
Drafting internal memos or fairness opinion documents that summarize a transaction’s details, valuation, and fairness conclusion for approval processes.
Preparing required disclosures, regulatory filings (e.g. prospectus sections), or ensuring research reports comply with regulations, often involving summarizing complex rules.
Researching and identifying the right subject-matter experts for a client’s project, using databases and outreach (matching expert background to the research topic).
Reading a client’s project brief and distilling the key research questions to guide the expert search and call preparation.
Preparing briefing materials or question lists for an expert call, including background research on the topic and what insights are sought.
Moderating or listening in on expert calls and ensuring the conversation stays on track; sometimes clarifying or rephrasing questions for the expert.
Recording expert calls and generating transcripts (often via AI) and then editing for accuracy and compliance (ensuring no confidential info).
After the call, producing a summary or key insights memo for the client, highlighting the expert’s most important points (increasingly aided by AI summaries).
Enabling clients to query the transcript using AI (LLM) to extract specific answers or sentiments from the discussion.
Reviewing multiple expert call transcripts on the same topic and synthesizing common insights or divergent opinions into a comparative report.
Analyzing transcripts to remove or flag any material non-public information or breaches of compliance before sharing with clients (could be partly automated with AI).
Organizing and tagging transcripts in a library, and extracting meta-information (industry, companies, topics) so that clients or internal teams can easily search for insights.

sector: Financial Data Providers (e.g. Bloomberg, S&P Capital IQ, YCharts, Quartr)

use_cases.description: Handling natural-language queries to fetch financial data (e.g. “What was Company X’s revenue growth in 2022?”), using AI to interpret the query and retrieve exact data.
Generating quick company or market reports that summarize key financial metrics, news, and charts, for user-defined parameters.
Providing earnings call transcripts immediately after or during calls, often with real-time updates. [cite_start](LLM assistance: live transcription and error correction) .
Using NLP/LLM to produce succinct summaries of earnings calls or investor presentations for users who want quick takeaways.
Running sentiment analysis on text (earnings calls, news) and detecting keyword trends or anomalies across thousands of documents.
Enabling users to compare companies on various metrics or textual disclosures (e.g. compare how two firms discuss strategy), often with AI-generated commentary on differences.
Aggregating financial news and using AI to summarize important developments for each portfolio or watchlist (e.g. a daily news brief per user’s holdings).

Offering a chatbot interface where users ask questions (in plain language) about data or filings (e.g. “show me the 5-year CAGR of EPS for the S&P 500 tech sector”) and receive answers with relevant data.
Using AI to parse financial reports or SEC filings and extract structured data or key passages (for example, pulling out all risk factors, or all mentions of “guidance”).
Writing short analytical pieces or alerts based on data (e.g. “unexpected drop in gross margin this quarter – likely causes”) automatically for platform users.
Providing instant, AI-driven answers to customer inquiries about accounts, transactions, or financial products, in natural language.
Analyzing a retail customer’s financial data (spending patterns, saving rates) and generating a summary or advice (e.g. budgeting tips, unusual spending alerts).
When flagging potentially fraudulent transactions, generating an explanation or summary that a human reviewer or customer can understand (translating anomaly detection into plain language).
Extracting and verifying information from uploaded documents (IDs, financial statements) and summarizing key risk factors or compliance issues for review.
Monitoring regulatory changes (e.g. new fintech regulations or tax laws) and summarizing what the business or customers need to know.
Reading and summarizing financial statements or credit reports of a small business or individual applicant to assist in credit decisioning (LLM can highlight strengths/risks).
Providing AI-generated investment recommendations or rebalancing suggestions for retail investors, with explanations (e.g. “Based on your risk profile, consider shifting X to bonds”).
For B2B fintech serving banks, analyzing client usage data or transaction data and summarizing insights (like which features reduce churn, etc.).
Automatically creating financial reports or earnings summaries for fintech products (e.g. a summary of a user’s investment performance or a business’s cash flow).
Summarizing the differences between financial products (credit cards, insurance, investment options) for customers, to aid choice.
Generating personalized financial insights content (like blog-style articles or newsletters) for users based on their interests or portfolio (e.g. explaining “what is DeFi?” to a crypto user).
Writing regular market updates for clients (daily/weekly emails or videos) that summarize financial market movements and outlook in an accessible way.
Researching stocks, funds, or other assets to recommend to clients; summarizing analyst reports and distilling key points for the client’s context.
Analyzing a client’s portfolio performance and risk (vs. benchmarks or goals) and preparing a concise report or presentation highlighting important changes or needed actions.
Drafting comprehensive financial plans for clients (retirement planning, education funding, etc.), which involves analyzing client data and summarizing recommended strategies in clear language.
Responding to client questions (e.g. “Should I refinance my mortgage?” or “What does this market event mean for me?”) with well-researched, easy-to-understand answers.
Evaluating new investment products (mutual funds, structured products, insurance policies) and summarizing the pros/cons, fees, and fit for the client’s objectives.
Preparing or filling required documents (account forms, KYC updates, suitability questionnaires) and ensuring accuracy, often translating forms into layman terms for clients.
Identifying when a client’s portfolio is off target allocation and analyzing trades needed; summarizing the rebalancing rationale for client approval.
Reviewing a client’s holdings for tax implications (realized gains/losses, asset location) and summarizing strategies to improve after-tax returns (requiring research into tax rules).
After calls/meetings, summarizing discussion points, action items, and any recommendations in a follow-up email or memo for the client.
Creating short explainers or slide decks to educate clients on financial concepts (e.g. diversification, options basics), personalized to their level of knowledge.
Analyzing long-term asset mix (equities, bonds, alternatives) against liabilities and market conditions; summarizing recommendations for policy changes.
Drafting or updating Investment Policy Statements and guidelines, which involves summarizing objectives, risk tolerance, and constraints in formal documents.
Evaluating external asset managers or funds (e.g. reviewing performance, strategy, and operations); writing summary reports with recommendations on hiring/retaining managers.
Analyzing portfolio performance vs. benchmarks and identifying drivers of returns; producing clear reports for boards or oversight committees.
Conducting “what-if” analyses on the portfolio (e.g. interest rate spikes, recession scenarios) and summarizing the projected impact and possible mitigation steps.
Compiling briefing books for trustees or investment committees, including executive summaries of the portfolio status, key decisions needed, and market outlook.
Summarizing required actuarial reports or funding status updates in plain language for stakeholders, and ensuring compliance with reporting standards.
Researching environmental, social, governance factors and integrating them into investment decisions; preparing summaries on ESG exposure and progress for the fund.
Projecting pension cash inflows/outflows and ensuring sufficient liquidity; analyzing and clearly communicating any liquidity stress tests results.
Drafting letters or newsletters to plan beneficiaries or institutional stakeholders explaining portfolio performance, changes in strategy, or important financial news in an understandable way.
Writing quarterly earnings press releases that clearly communicate financial results and key business updates, ensuring messaging is on-point and compliant.
Preparing the CEO/CFO script for earnings calls (summarizing results and guidance) and compiling likely Q&A questions with suggested talking points.
Building the quarterly (or deal-related) investor deck that visualizes financial performance, strategy, and outlook; distilling complex data into slides.
Fielding questions from analysts and investors via calls or emails and providing timely, consistent answers (often by quickly retrieving or summarizing relevant info).
Contributing to the MD&A and other narrative sections of 10-K/10-Q filings by summarizing the period’s performance and ensuring alignment with other disclosures.
Monitoring competitors’ news, earnings calls, and analyst reports; summarizing relevant insights to inform management and adjust messaging if needed.
Maintaining up-to-date investor relations website content (financial data, FAQs) and creating annual reports or ESG reports, which involves summarizing achievements and initiatives.
Preparing comprehensive presentations and speeches for investor days or capital markets days, which synthesize long-term strategy and detailed business segment information.
Gathering and analyzing investor feedback, analyst sentiment, and stock price movements; distilling this into internal reports to inform management of market perception.
Drafting statements or Q&As for special situations (e.g. an earnings miss, leadership change), summarizing the issue and key messages to maintain trust and clarity.
Running annual or quarterly budgeting processes and multi-year forecasts; analyzing historical data and projecting future financials for the company.
Comparing actual financial results to budget, identifying reasons for variances, and summarizing findings in management reports.
Preparing concise monthly or quarterly reports for executives (e.g. KPI dashboards, financial highlights) with commentary on trends and issues.
Conducting ad-hoc analyses for strategic decisions (e.g. evaluating a capital investment, pricing change, or M&A opportunity) and summarizing the financial impact.
Aggregating financial data from various business units or systems into a coherent format; using tools (and possibly AI) to streamline data prep for analysis.
Creating models (often Excel-based) for scenarios like new product launches or restructuring, and using them to answer “what if” questions for the company.
Crafting personalized financial plans for individuals, including retirement projections, insurance needs, and estate planning, and writing up the plan in client-friendly language.
Evaluating a client’s investment portfolio performance vs. goals or benchmarks and producing a summary report with observations and recommended adjustments.
Reviewing client files, recent communications, and market updates to prepare an agenda; summarizing complex financial topics into digestible talking points for the meeting.
Explaining financial concepts, recommendations, or market developments to clients through emails, calls, or presentations (translating jargon into clear advice).
Researching various financial products (funds, insurance, loans) for a client’s needs and summarizing the options with pros/cons and a recommendation.
Projecting departmental costs or headcount needs and analyzing financial efficiency; summarizing these analyses for department heads in advisory capacity.
